Key Match Events: Daz Cameron made a diving catch to rob Jeremy Peña of a hit in the 10th inning.
Zack Gelof hit a 17th homer this season.
Jose Altuve hit an RBI double leading off the bottom half of the 12th inning.
Bryan Abreu struck out the side in the 11th inning.
Daz Cameron made a diving catch to rob Jeremy Peña of a hit in the 10th inning.
Zack Gelof scored on a sacrifice by Max Schuemann in the 12th inning.
Nick Allen bunted into a forceout that scored Daz Cameron for a 4-2 lead in the 12th inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Houston manager Joe Espada was disappointed in his team's defense in the 12th.
Oakland manager Mark Kotsay said the team had a couple of guys up there that can bunt and they do a good job with it with Schuman and Allen.
Houston manager Joe Espada said the team had the right guys at the plate when they wanted to and they just couldn’t get the hit.
Oakland manager Mark Kotsay said the team took their chances there getting a run.
Post-Match Reflections: Houston manager Joe Espada said the team battled to the end.
Oakland manager Mark Kotsay said the team had a well-executed inning in the 12th.
Houston manager Joe Espada said they just didn’t do a good job of handling the ball there in that inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Oakland starter JP Sears allowed four hits and walked two in six scoreless innings.
Houston's Spencer Arrighetti tied a season high by allowing seven hits with two runs in 6 2/3 innings.
Athletics: RHP Osvaldo Bido, who was scheduled to start Tuesday’s game, was instead placed on the 15-day injured list, retroactive to Sunday, with right wrist flexor tendonitis.
Astros: OF Chas McCormick left in the middle of the fifth with right wrist discomfort.
Houston RHP Hunter Brown (11-7, 3.41 ERA) opposes RHP Joey Estes (6-7, 4.46) when the series continues Wednesday night.
